secret.sharing

Class Dealer

  • java.lang.Object
    • secret.sharing.Dealer

  • public class Dealer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a secret sharing dealer
    Author:
    Benjamin Weigl

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ContainerSize
      Fixed container size of 128 bit
      private java.lang.String mPassPhrase
      An optional pass phrase for the encryption and integrity check

      The fixed prime number to define the finite field for all calculations.
      private secret.sharing.RandomPolynomial mRandomPolynomial
      A random polynomial to calculate shares
      private int mShareCount
      The number of shares the dealer shall produce

      The minimum number of shares required to rebuild the secret

    • Field Detail

      • mPrime

        private static final java.math.BigInteger mPrime
        The fixed prime number to define the finite field for all calculations. The bit size of this prime number is 129, so the container size is set to 128 bit to ensure any number n less than mPrime

      • ContainerSize

        public static final int ContainerSize
        Fixed container size of 128 bit
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mThreshold

        private int mThreshold
        The minimum number of shares required to rebuild the secret

        The number of shares the dealer shall produce

        An optional pass phrase for the encryption and integrity check

      • mRandomPolynomial

        private secret.sharing.RandomPolynomial mRandomPolynomial
        A random polynomial to calculate shares

                                           javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                           javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                           org.bouncycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException
        Encrypts a array of byte data
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to encrypt. the data has to be a multiple of the container size
        Returns:
        a list of encrypted container
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException

      • createShareHolder

        private secret.sharing.ShareHolder[] createShareHolder(byte[][] encryptedDataBlocks)
        Do the actual magic and create the shares using the encrypted data
        Parameters:
        encryptedDataBlocks - a list of encrypted data container
        Returns:
        an array of shareholder, holding the related shares

      • calculateShares

        private byte[][] calculateShares(byte[] secretData)
        Calculate the shares using the shamir's secret sharing scheme
        Parameters:
        secretData - the actual secret
        Returns:
        a list of secret shares (sometimes referred as shadows)

      • rebuildSecretDataBlocks

        private byte[][] rebuildSecretDataBlocks(secret.sharing.ShareHolder[] shareHolder)
        Rebuild the secret hidden in the array of shareholder
        Parameters:
        shareHolder - a bunch of shareholder which should be related to each other
        Returns:
        a list of mostly encrypted secret data container

      • calculateCFactors

        private java.math.BigInteger[] calculateCFactors(int threshold,
                                                 secret.sharing.ShareHolder[] shareHolder)
        Calculates the c-factors of the Lagrange Interpolation
        Parameters:
        threshold - the minimum shares needed to rebuilt the secret, in this case the count of shares uses to rebuilt the secret
        shareHolder - the list of shareholder. here we get our indices
        Returns:
        an array of c-factors in order of the related shareholder

      • calculateSecretDataBlocks

        private byte[][] calculateSecretDataBlocks(java.math.BigInteger[] cFactors,
                                           int threshold,
                                           int blockcount,
                                           secret.sharing.ShareHolder[] shareHolder)
        Calculates the secret data by Lagrange Interpolation
        Parameters:
        cFactors - a list of c-factors (see calculateCFactors)
        threshold - the minimum number of shareholder to use for calculation
        blockcount - the number of secrets in the shareholder
        shareHolder - the list of shareholder
        Returns:
        the calculated secret in blocks size of container size

      • decryptEncryptedDataBlocks

        private byte[] decryptEncryptedDataBlocks(byte[][] encryptedDataBlocks)
                                   throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                          org.bouncycastle.crypto.DataLengthException,
                                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,

                                          javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                          org.bouncycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Decrypts a set of data blocks and joins the data back to the secret
        Parameters:
        encryptedDataBlocks - the encrypted data blocks
        Returns:
        the decrypted secret
        Throws:
